details.description: Winter Fuel Payment is an allowance to help older people with their heating bills - claim form, how much you get, eligibility

parts.title: Overview
parts.body:
You could get between £100 and £300 tax-free to help pay your heating bills if you were born on or before 5 July 1951. This known as a ‘Winter Fuel Payment’.

Most payments are made automatically between November and December. You should get your money by Christmas.

You should get a Winter Fuel Payment automatically if you get the State Pension or another social security benefit (not Housing Benefit, Council Tax Benefit or Child Benefit).

If you qualify but don’t get paid automatically, you’ll need to make a claim.

Any money you get won’t affect your other benefits.

parts.title: What you'll get
parts.body:
How much you get depends on your circumstances during the qualifying week. For winter 2012 to 2013 this was 17 to 23 September 2012.

Circumstance Born on or before 5 July 1951 Aged 80 or over in the qualifying week
You qualify and live alone (or none of the people you live with qualify) £200 £300
You qualify and get one of the benefits listed** £200 £300
You live with someone under 80 who also qualifies £100 £200
You live with someone 80 or over who also qualifies £100 £150
You qualify and live with your partner or civil partner and they get one of the benefits listed** Nil*** Nil***
You qualify but live in a care home and don’t get one of the benefits listed** £100 £150

** Benefits: Pension Credit, income-based Jobseeker’s Allowance (JSA), income-related Employment and Support Allowance (ESA)

*** Your partner getting the benefit will get the Winter Fuel Payment on your behalf

You’ll get a letter telling you how much you’ll get and an estimated payment date.

How you’re paid

Most payments are made automatically between November and December. You should get your money by Christmas.

If you qualify and you’re not getting a social security benefit (or if you only get Housing Benefit, Council Tax Benefit or Child Benefit), you’ll need to make a claim.

All benefits, pensions and allowances are paid into an account, eg a bank account.

parts.title: Eligibility
parts.body:
Usually, you’ll qualify for Winter Fuel Payment if:

  • you were born on or before 5 July 1951 (winter 2012 to 2013 - this date changes every year)
  • you normally live in the UK throughout the week of 17 to 23 September 2012

You may still be able to get the payment if you live in another European Economic Area (EEA) country or Switzerland. You’ll need to fill in a different claim form.

You must have a genuine link with the UK to claim from abroad.

Exceptions

You don’t qualify if throughout the week of 17 to 23 September 2012 you:

  • were in prison
  • were in hospital getting free treatment for more than 52 weeks
  • needed permission to enter the UK and didn’t qualify for help from the Department for Work and Pensions
  • lived in a care home for the previous 12 weeks or more and got Pension Credit, income-based Jobseeker’s Allowance or income-related Employment and Support Allowance

Change of circumstance

Report any change of circumstance as these can affect how much you get. For example, if the qualifying person stops getting a benefit, moves out, dies or goes into care.

Contact the office paying your Winter Fuel Payment (their details are on any letters they sent you). If you’ve not received a payment before, contact the helpline.

Winter Fuel Payment Helpline

Telephone: 0845 915 1515
Textphone: 0845 6015613
From outside the UK: +44 (0)191 218 7777
Monday to Friday, 8:30am to 4:30pm

parts.title: How to claim
parts.body:
You need to claim if you’re not getting a social security benefit (or if you only get Housing Benefit, Council Tax Benefit or Child Benefit). You only need to do this once to get paid every year, as long as your circumstances haven’t changed.

There’s a different form for claiming if you’re in the UK or abroad.

Your claim must be received on or before 31 March 2013 for any payments to be made.

Claim form if you’re in the UK

Download ‘Winter Fuel Payment claim form - UK’ (PDF, 215KB)

Send the form to:

Winter Fuel Payment Team
Department for Work and Pensions
PO Box 10142
Annesley
Nottingham
NG15 5WY

Claim form if you’re in another European Economic Area (EEA) country or Switzerland

Download ‘Winter Fuel Payment claim form - EEA and Switzerland’ (PDF, 215KB)

Send the form to:

Winter Fuel Payment Team
International Pension Centre
Tyneview Park
Newcastle Upon Tyne
NE98 1BA

If you move to another country (outside the EEA or Switzerland) you won’t be eligible for a Winter Fuel Payment.

Claim form for past winters

If you’re eligible, you can claim Winter Fuel Payments for the winters between 1997 to 1998 and 1999 to 2000.

You can’t make a late claim for winters from 2000 to 2001 onwards.

Download ‘Winter Fuel Payment claim form - past winters’ (PDF, 265KB)

Send the form to:

Winter Fuel Payment Centre
Department for Work and Pensions
PO Box 22
Gateshead
NE92 1BX

Winter Fuel Payment Helpline

Enquiry form
Telephone: 08459 15 15 15
Textphone: 0845 601 5613
Calling from outside the UK: +44 (0)191 218 7777
Monday to Friday 8am to 5:30pm

Appeal a decision

You can appeal the decision about your Winter Fuel Payment if you’re unhappy with it.

Download ‘Appeal against a benefit decision (leaflet GL24)’ (PDF, 5MB)
